Mortars can have a range up to 4,680m. A slingshot is a string weapon that propels a rock or other small projectile. Some slingshots can fire projectiles up to 9m.

facts: A creature's tongue is inside its mouth. A creature's mouth is part of its head.

description: Chemical element with atomic number 80

facts: The density of an object determines if it will float. An object will float if it is less dense than the liquid it is placed in. Mercury is liquid at room temperature. The density of mercury is 13.56 g/cm3. The density of a penny is 7.15 g/cm3.

facts: Jalapeno peppers contain capsaicin.  Capsaicin creates a burning sensation in the eyes and can lead to surface injuries.  Small children do not understand how to protect themselves from peppers or how to wash their hands properly.

facts: The cory catfish is a fish that is described as a bottom feeder. The cory catfish feeds on food located at the bottom of an ocean. Fish cannot live too deep in oceans for very long because of the intense water pressure. The bottom of oceans is populated by algae, coral, and microorganisms.

The Capricorn is the zodiac sign symbolized by the goat. The Tarot card attributed to the Zodiac sign Capricorn is The Devil.

description: unit of time

facts: The solar cycle is measured by the year: the length of one orbit, as well as by day: the length of one of Earth's rotation about its axis. However, months are based on the lunar cycle, how the shadow of the Earth on the moon causes it to appear to grow and shrink and change shape over the course of four weeks.

description: 14th-century King of England and Duke of Aquitaine
question: Would Edward II of England have been born without Vikings?
facts: Edward II was King of England from 1307-1327. Rollo was a Viking who became the first ruler of Normandy. Edward II is related to William the Conqueror through Rollo's granddaughter's line (Empress Matilda).

description: one of the Earth's four temperate seasons, occurring between autumn and spring
question: Are there multiple American government holidays during winter?
facts: Winter runs from about December 20 to about March 20. Government holidays include Christmas, New Year, King Day, and President's Day. description: 1982 American science fiction film directed by Steven Spielberg

facts: An urban legend is a humorous or horrifying story based on hearsay that is circulated as true. E.T. the Extra Terrestrial was panned as one of the worst video games ever made. A widespread story stated that thousands of copies of E.T. the Extra Terrestrial video game were buried in a landfill A former Atari manager stated that 728,000 Atari games were in fact buried in a landfill. The Atari landfill was dug up and nearly 900 games were recovered, but there was only one copy of E.T. included.
